Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state D,$P_{D}=P_1$ and $V_{D}=V_2$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state A,$P_{A}=P_1$ and $V_{A}=V_1$
According to the ideal gas equation of state $ rac{P_{A}V_{A}}{T_{A}}= rac{P_{D}V_{D}}{T_{D}}$, $T_{D}= rac{p_{1}v_{2}}{p_{1}v_{1}}T_{0}$ can be obtained
